overview: The Christmas Bonus is a one-off tax-free £10 payment to people who get certain benefits - what you'll get, eligibility, how to claim
title: Christmas Bonus

table.body: The Christmas Bonus is a one-off tax-free £10 payment made before Christmas, paid to people who get certain benefits in the qualifying week. This is normally the first full week of December.
table.title: Overview

table.body:
The Christmas Bonus is a one-off payment of £10.

^ The Christmas Bonus payment won't affect any other benefits you get ^

**How the Christmas Bonus is paid**

All benefits, pensions and allowances are paid into an account, eg your bank account.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
To get a Christmas Bonus you must live in the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man, Gibraltar, any European Economic Area (EEA) country, or Switzerland. You must also get at least one of the following benefits in the qualifying week (normally the first full week of December):

- Attendance Allowance
- Carer's Allowance
- Constant Attendance Allowance (paid under Industrial Injuries or War Pensions schemes)
- Contribution-based Employment and Support Allowance (once the main phase of the benefit is entered after the first 13 weeks of claim)
- Disability Living Allowance
- Incapacity Benefit at the long-term rate
- Industrial Death Benefit (for widows or widowers)
- Mobility Supplement
- Pension Credit - the guarantee element
- State Pension (including Graduated Retirement Benefit)
- Severe Disablement Allowance (transitionally protected)
- Unemployability Supplement or Allowance (paid under Industrial Injuries or War Pensions schemes)
- War Disablement Pension if over State Pension age
- War Widow's Pension
- Widowed Mother's Allowance
- Widowed Parent's Allowance
- Widow's Pension

^ If you're entitled to a State Pension but haven't claimed it, you won't get a Christmas Bonus ^
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
You don't need to claim the Christmas Bonus - you should get it automatically. 

If you think you should get it, but haven't, contact the [Jobcentre Plus office](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "Jobcentre Plus office"){:rel="external"} or [pension centre](http://www.direct.gov.uk/en/Pensionsandretirementplanning/StatePension/DG_180132 "pension centre"){:rel="external"} that deals with your payments.
table.title: How to claim

table.body:
If you're part of a married or unmarried couple or civil partnership and both of you get one of the qualifying benefits you'll each get a Christmas Bonus payment.

Your partner or civil partner will also get payments if both the following apply:

- you're both over State Pension age by the start of the qualifying week
- your partner or civil partner was also resident in the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man, Gibraltar, EEA country or Switzerland at the start of the qualifying week

and either:

- you're entitled to an increase of a qualifying benefit for your partner or civil partner
- the only qualifying benefit you're getting is Pension Credit
